Legal_Issue: Who bears the risk when email notices are sent by a visa officer but not received by the applicant's agent?
Application_Facts: Applicants did not receive emails requesting additional documentation despite due diligence in maintaining their email systems. The DSN messages did not confirm receipt, only relay. No fault was found on the applicant's side.
Decision_Outcome: Judicial review allowed; original decisions quashed; matters remitted for re-determination.
Court_Ruling: Respondent (government) bears the risk of failed email communication as they chose to send critical notices via email without safeguards.
Defendant_Behavior: Sent critical notices via email without confirmation of receipt or adequate safeguards
Legal_Standard: Procedural fairness requires that applicants receive meaningful notice of requests for additional information
Procedural_Issue: Failure to ensure receipt of procedural notices sent by email
Evidence_Used: DSN messages indicating email relay but not receipt
Evidence of applicant's due diligence in maintaining email system
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA provisions on procedural fairness and application requirements
Application_Basis: Immigration applications refused due to non-receipt of requested documentation
Evidence_Assessed: Email transmission logs, applicant's email management practices
Relief_Sought: Quashing of refusal decisions and re-determination of applications
Governing_Rule: Under IRPA, applicants must provide all required documents. Procedural fairness requires meaningful notice.
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of confirmation of email receipt despite successful transmission
Harm_Assessment: Applicants prejudiced by inability to respond to document requests due to non-receipt
Cause_Description: Immigration applications were refused because applicants did not receive emails requesting additional documentation
Evidence_Handling: Reliance on DSN messages that confirm relay but not actual receipt
Legal_Provision_Violated: Principles of procedural fairness under IRPA
Evidence_Issues: No confirmation of actual receipt of emails, only proof of dispatch
Evidence_Assessment: Applicant demonstrated due diligence; no fault attributed to them
Decision_Rationale: Government assumed risk of communication failure by using email without verification mechanism
Decision_Making_Body: Visa Officer, Federal Court (on judicial review)
Evidentiary_Issues: Absence of read receipts or delivery confirmations for critical notices
